snippet: Security officers at Churchill Downs called the Louisville police just before 5 a.m. after discovering the body of a Guatemalan man in a barn occupied by a longtime horse trainer.
abstract: Churchill Downs track worker Adan F Perez, a Guatemalan immigrant, is found dead in a barn on the racetrack grounds only hours after the Kentucky Derby; his death is being investigated as a homicide. (M)

byline.original: By JOE DRAPE and CHANNING JOSEPH; Joe Drape reported from Louisville, and Channing Joseph from New York. Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting from Washington

lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. -- A Guatemalan immigrant was found dead in a barn at Churchill Downs on Sunday morning just hours after the Kentucky Derby was run. The police said the man had been murdered. The immigrant, Adan F. Perez, 48, was working and living in the stables, said Jo-Ann Farmer, the chief deputy coroner for Jefferson County. She said he was identified on Sunday afternoon by his 19-year-old son, who also worked there.

headline.main: Body Is Found At Racetrack After the Derby
